title: Quiz 3: FQE June 2022
description: Full exam paper from June 2022 FQE covering MCQs, Short Answer Questions on definitions and AMTSL, and a Long Answer Question.

questions.question: One of the following is the most common direct cause of maternal death:
questions.explanation: Postpartum Hemorrhage (PPH) is the leading direct cause of maternal mortality globally and in Kenya, accounting for roughly 25-30% of maternal deaths.
questions.hint: Think about the condition causing rapid blood loss.

questions.question: Which of the following cohorts is correctly matched as delineated in NHSSP II?
questions.explanation: Under the Kenya Essential Package for Health (KEPH): Cohort 1 (Pregnancy/Newborn), Cohort 2 (Early Childhood), Cohort 3 (Late Childhood), Cohort 4 (Adolescents/Youth).
questions.hint: Cohort 1 starts at the beginning of life.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a basic emergency obstetric care function?
questions.explanation: Blood Transfusion and C-Section are Comprehensive EmONC functions. Basic (BEmONC) covers the other listed interventions.
questions.hint: Which procedure requires a fully equipped theater or lab?

questions.question: One of the following is true about pelvic outlet:

options.text: Posterior landmarks of the pelvis are coccyx and sacrum
Laterally, it is bounded by the sacrum

questions.explanation: The anatomical outlet is bounded posteriorly by the coccyx. The obstetric outlet is bounded by the sacrum.
questions.hint: Think about the posterior boundary.

questions.question: Regarding diameters of fetal skull, which one of the following is correct?

options.text: Sub-occipito-bregmatic diameter presents when the head is almost fully flexed
The face presents when the head is fully extended

questions.explanation: Face presentation occurs in complete extension of the head. SOB presents in FULL flexion.
questions.hint: What presentation results from maximum extension?

questions.question: Match the degree of moulding with its description:
questions.explanation: Moulding classification: 0 (separated), 1 (touching), 2 (reducible overlap), 3 (irreducible overlap).
questions.hint: Think about the severity of overlap.

questions.question: Most common cause of edema in pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: Dependent edema occurs in up to 80% of healthy pregnant women due to water retention and venous compression.
questions.hint: Is swelling always pathological in pregnancy?

questions.question: Which of the following is an indicator of malnutrition in pregnant women?

options.text: Weight gain of 500 grams in 1st trimester

questions.explanation: Mid-Upper Arm Circumference (MUAC) less than 23cm indicates maternal wasting/malnutrition.
questions.hint: This measurement is taken on the arm.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a danger sign in labour?
questions.explanation: Cord prolapse is an obstetric emergency threatening fetal life.
questions.hint: Which of these cuts off the baby's blood supply immediately?

questions.question: Mary has delivered 2 sets of twins, 3 singletons and gives a history of an ectopic pregnancy at 8 weeks. She is currently pregnant at 36 weeks. Calculate her Parity.
questions.explanation: Parity = Delivery events >28wks. 2 (twins) + 3 (singletons) = 5. Plus 1 ectopic (+1). Result: Para 5+1.
questions.hint: Count the delivery events, not the number of children.

questions.question: One of the following represents an OPTIONAL laboratory investigation during antenatal care in a primigravida residing in NYERI:
questions.explanation: Nyeri is a non-endemic zone for malaria, so routine screening is optional unless symptomatic.
questions.hint: Consider the geographical prevalence of diseases.

questions.question: Mary has an LMP of 12th March 2021. Calculate her EDD (DD/MM/YYYY).
questions.explanation: Naegele's Rule: 12 + 7 = 19. March + 9 = December. Year 2021. Date: 19/12/2021.
questions.hint: Add 7 days, add 9 months.

questions.question: Which one of the following is true about hormonal changes associated with menopause?

options.text: There is no reduction in circulating androgens

questions.explanation: Menopause is characterized by follicular depletion, leading to low Estrogen and high FSH/LH.
questions.hint: What happens to the ovarian follicles?

questions.question: MDG concerned with improving maternal health is:
questions.explanation: MDG 5 focused on Maternal Health. MDG 4 was Child Mortality.
questions.hint: It comes after the goal for child mortality.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a sign of placental separation?

options.text: The uterus becomes soft and globular
Clots of blood appear from vagina
Umbilical cord lengthens outside the vagina

questions.explanation: Cord lengthening is a classic sign. The uterus becomes FIRM and globular, not soft.
questions.hint: What happens to the cord length?

questions.question: Elective induction of labour may be performed when the Bishop score is:
questions.explanation: A high Bishop score (>8 or 10) indicates a favorable cervix ready for labor.
questions.hint: Higher score means more favorable.

questions.question: One of the following is a fetal indication for induction of labour:
questions.explanation: Prolonged pregnancy is primarily induced to prevent fetal compromise (post-maturity). The others are often maternal indications.
questions.hint: Which condition directly risks the fetus due to aging placenta?

questions.question: The commonest cause of UTI in pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: E. coli causes 80-90% of UTIs.
questions.hint: Common gut bacteria.

questions.question: Which one of the following is true concerning Intermittent Preventive Treatment for malaria (IPTp) in Kenya?

options.text: Administer IPTP any time during her pregnancy
Folic acid should not be administered with IPTP

questions.explanation: Folic acid antagonizes SP (Fansidar) and should be withheld for 14 days post-dose.
questions.hint: Interaction between supplements and the drug.

questions.question: One of the following is true about the use of quinine in management of malaria in pregnancy:

options.text: Dose reduction is required in renal insufficiency
Administer with glucose infusion to avoid hypoglycemia
Patients with hepatic insufficiency need dose reduction by half

questions.explanation: Quinine stimulates insulin secretion, causing hypoglycemia.
questions.hint: What metabolic side effect is common with Quinine?

questions.question: Tubal factor associated with development of ectopic pregnancy is:
questions.explanation: Salpingitis damages tubal cilia/patency.
questions.hint: Inflammation of the tube.

questions.question: Spontaneous isthmic rupture of ectopic pregnancy occurs at:
questions.explanation: The isthmus is narrow, leading to early rupture.
questions.hint: Isthmus is the narrowest part.

questions.question: Probable (symptoms) manifestations of pregnancy include the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Chloasma, Linea Nigra, and Striae are classified as cutaneous Probable signs. Leucorrhoea is a non-specific symptom.
questions.hint: Which one is just a discharge?

questions.question: Jane a para 3+2 presents with per-vaginal bleeding for 1 day and lower abdominal pains. O/E: Cervical OS is open and membranes bulging. Gestation 24/40. Diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Open os + Bulging membranes + Pain/Bleeding = Inevitable Abortion.
questions.hint: The process has started and cannot be stopped.

questions.question: Which of the following is a possible maternal cause of the above diagnosis (Inevitable abortion)?
questions.explanation: Cervical incompetence typically presents in the mid-trimester with dilation.
questions.hint: Weakness of the neck of the womb.

questions.question: An investigation carried out for evidence purpose in rape survivor is:
questions.explanation: Finding sperm confirms sexual contact forensically.
questions.hint: Forensic evidence of male contact.

questions.question: Which of the following is a clinical sign (objective) of severe preeclampsia?
questions.explanation: Hyperreflexia is elicited by the doctor (sign), others are reported by patient (symptoms).
questions.hint: Which one does the doctor check with a hammer?

questions.question: Normal postpartum discharge begins as:
questions.explanation: Lochia Rubra (Red) is the first stage.
questions.hint: Like fresh blood.

questions.question: A woman is said to be in active labour if cervical dilatation is at least:
questions.explanation: Active phase starts at 4 cm.
questions.hint: The start of the active phase.

questions.question: One of the following is true about management of preterm premature rupture of membranes:

options.text: The mother can be managed as outpatient
Monitor pulse and temperature once in a day

questions.explanation: Antibiotics prolong latency and reduce infection.
questions.hint: Prevents chorioamnionitis.

questions.question: Control of seizures in eclampsia is achieved by:
questions.explanation: MgSO4 is the gold standard.
questions.hint: Standard anticonvulsant in OB.

questions.question: Which of the following is a warning sign suggestive of cardiac disease in pregnancy?

options.text: Chest pain with exercise or activity

questions.explanation: Chest pain (Angina) is pathological. Fatigue and flow murmurs are common in pregnancy.
questions.hint: Pain in the chest is never normal.

questions.question: Which of the following laboratory investigation confirms sickle cell disease?
questions.explanation: Electrophoresis separates hemoglobin types (HbS, HbA).
questions.hint: Separates hemoglobin types.

questions.question: HIV/AIDS may have the following MATERNAL effects in pregnancy EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: LBW is a fetal effect. The others affect the mother's condition.
questions.hint: Which one describes the baby's size?

questions.question: Which of the following is a maternal risk factor for MTCT during labour and delivery?
questions.explanation: APH facilitates mixing of maternal/fetal blood.
questions.hint: Involves bleeding.

questions.question: Which one of the following combined oral contraceptives is triphasic?
questions.explanation: Logynon has varying doses. Microgynon is monophasic.
questions.hint: Three phases.

questions.question: Which one of the following is a possible cause of genital ulcer syndrome?
questions.explanation: Donovanosis causes ulcers.
questions.hint: Causes Donovanosis.

questions.question: Most common cause of obstetric fistula is:
questions.explanation: Prolonged pressure necrosis.
questions.hint: Labor that stops progressing.

questions.question: Which of the following is a FETAL cause of intrauterine fetal demise?
questions.explanation: Anomalies are intrinsic to the fetus.
questions.hint: Problem with the baby's development.

questions.question: Which of the following is applied for growth monitoring in pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Serial scans monitor growth.
questions.hint: Imaging.

questions.question: Match the following terms with their definitions:
questions.explanation: Standard epidemiological definitions.
questions.hint: Match the term to its statistical meaning.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of Active Management of Third Stage of Labour (AMSTL) in the correct sequence:
questions.explanation: 1. Rule out twin. 2. Give Oxytocin. 3. CCT. 4. Massage.
questions.hint: Drug comes before traction.

questions.question: Select the objectives/actions of Focused Antenatal Care (FANC) used to prevent complications: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Standard preventative measures include TT, IPTp, IFAS, and Deworming.
questions.hint: Prophylactic measures.

questions.question: Match the menstrual abnormality with its definition:
questions.explanation: Definitions of abnormal uterine bleeding patterns.
questions.hint: Poly = many/frequent, Oligo = few/infrequent.

questions.question: Nafula, 22 years primigravida, has uncertain dates (irregular cycle) and presents with painful micturition. Which method is most accurate for ascertaining her gestational age if she is in the first trimester?

richContent.content: Clinical Scenario: Nafula, 22 years old primigravida, presents with painful micturition. She is unsure of her LMP due to irregular cycles.

questions.explanation: Early ultrasound (CRL measurement) is the gold standard for dating, especially with irregular cycles.
questions.hint: Imaging method.

questions.question: For Nafula (painful micturition), select the appropriate management plan steps: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Treat UTI with safe antibiotics (Cipro is contraindicated in pregnancy), hydrate, and confirm cure.
questions.hint: Avoid quinolones in pregnancy.
